reviews.review: I just finished this game 2 years later than everyone else. I wasnt even going to play it..lol my friend told me this game was a good game so i tried it out so i did and damn this is a fucking great game the story and that ending..i had to buy the season pass and i finished it in one day xD i went into this game expecting an average action shooter but now i know theres so much more and now that ive finished the game..i feel empty the only other game that gave me this feeling was the witcher 3. This game doesnt have as much content but in about 20 hours i manage to connect to the charecters in the way i never thought i would.. the lore is really deep and i wish i could erase my memories and replay this game.. so sad that its over and so empty...

Officialy this is the best game I've ever played. When you start playing it, the scenario, weapons and controls may seem rare because you were accustomed to the other Bioshock games, but every second you continue playing makes you love more this title. Finally, the end is the best I've experienced in all Pc and Xbox games of my life.

I just cannot put into words how much I appreciate this game. 

I played it once it came out in 2013 in a different platform and I've now re-lived the experience on PC with the DLCs. After 2 or 3 playthroughs I can still find slight details which I missed on the previous run.

Graphic wise, the game has its unique art. No, it is not photo realistic but I still love how it looks. Columbia immerses you into the early 20st century atmosphere like no other game, and the abrupt change to Rapture and its 1950s look really takes you by surprise. The amount of work put into every single part of the map by the artists is truly worth mentioning. Bioshock Infinite is a game in which you need to explore, see and experience, because there is much more to do and learn than just the main story.

The storyline is spectacular. I've played many games which had an amazing storyline that really gripped me, but none other left me with such a fulfillment as this game.  It has complexity, mystery, great characters, great setting and great pace. I don't want to spoil anything so I won't give many details, but boy... what a mind blowing experience.

And now we come to gameplay. I've read other reviews and I must say that I agree, the aspect that Bioshock Infinite lacks the most is the actual gameplay mechanics. Don't get me wrong, it is not like the game is unplayable or boring. I tend to play my games on normal difficulty because I don't really like challenges (and, let's face it, I suck). However, I found myself increasing the difficulty on the DLCs because I hardly died during the main storyline. There are too many action fights and gun shooting which just seem a bit repetitive and unnecesary. They are not so bad, though, but you won't need much help defeating them all. I actually forgot about the vigors (or plasmids) most of the times because I didn't really need them. That tells how something which was pretty cool (vigors) was kind of wasted because of how easy the game was. Anyway, I know I've developed more on what I consider negative about the game and not so much about the good things, but take it more as a rant because it hurts to see a great game wasting good mechanics.

All in all, the game is GREAT. The DLCs are really really worth it, I regret not having played them sooner. If you like shooters, not-so-long-to-finish games, great storylines and outstanding artwork... this is your game! Now, if you want to customize your character, great gun shooting and lots of playtime hours... you might want to consider this buy, maybe watch a couple of walkthroughs before reaching a decision.

I hope I helped you!

Buen juego de disparos. Tu misión consiste en rescatar a una chica, el lugar parece un paraíso donde los problemas no existen y todos son felices, pero poco a poco iras descubriendo lo que pasa.

En este juego tendrás la oportunidad de manejar varias armas y unas especies de pócimas que te irán dando diferentes poderes. Todo esto lo tendrás que ir configurando para poderlos utilizar, ya que en uso solo podrás manejar unos pocos (tendrás puntos en el juego para volver a reconfigurar estos poderes, según te veas las circunstancias).

Las expansiones de este juego también merecen la pena.

FIrst off, I know I downvoted this game even though it is pretty good. The issue I have is that it is far from the quality of the previous 2 and the last half felt rushed.

The rapture storylines where sooo much deeper and the endings were really awesome. This one, not so much. Actually I've had this game for a couple years and just got back into and only remeber a few things. Guess it didn't really have much that was memorable.

The Rapture world vs. this Columbia cloud world. Rapture kicks it's ass. I did like some of this world but as soon as I got to Fink town or whatever it was called and started doing the Mr. Chen/Daisy stuff the world just started sucking. I wish the enviroment stayed more like Soldier's Field & Battleship Bay.

The end sucked! and the not to spoil anything but the final battle was super out of place and I just kept dying only to restart it. Really gay since I played the whole game on hard for a challenge then the final battle was just stupid and nothing but waves of the same crap.

This game was, and is to this day, one of the best games to have ever been made. The likelihood of a game being released that tops it is...to say the least, highly improbable. The story is, without a doubt, the best story I have ever experienced within a video game (and I have played A LOT of video games). The combat can be stale at times (simply my opinion), but it's easily overlookable because of everything else; from the tear-jerking soundtrack to the absolutely stunning visuals...this game will make you feel, like no other game before. While not being a requirement, I would suggest you go back and play the previous two installments to the series, as you will feel a greater sense of closure, and hold a better understanding of the alternate history that is the Bioshock universe.

Bioshock infinite, I've heard alot about this game over the years and finally decided to pick it up to see what it was all about. First of all, let me talk about Elizabeth. She is the most helpful AI in battle, She throws you ammo, salts, and health, and even outside of combat, she gives you money. You can ask her to open these "tears" to gve you cover, hooks, Turrets, or machines which they can help take the heat off you. The devs really did a good job with her character. The gameplay isnt really anything to write home about. Its a hallway with a bunch of shooting galleries. The main storyline is interesting I wont spoil anything, but at the end you have that "OOoooooohhhhh shit" moment of realization. The problem is I dont see myself re-playing this game anytime soon.

It's better than its source-material inspiration and predecessors - The BioShock Series. 

BioShock Infinite takes the series to the skies and really does elevate and iterate this series tropes superiorly in every way. From gunplay, world and visual design to its mysterious storyline, BioShock Infinite is a great success and an excellent argument for the art of modern-day video games.
This game is so beautifully made and has such an amazing story to it. I highly recommend friends to play it.
Bioshock Infinite – это настоящее произведение искусства. Это не просто компьютерная игра – это приключение, позволяющее прожить другую жизнь. Не пропустите.

Ну вот и я решился написать обзор. BioShock Infinite - первая игра, после которой появилось желание выразить свой восторг. Ни одна игра ещё не оставляла столь положительных эмоций, прости Халфа и 4-й принц персии. Мир созданный Кевином Левином проработан до мелочей, что если ты будешь  не просто бегать и гасить врагов, а прослушаешь ещё журналы, то сам поверишь в этот мир, что он возможно где-то есть в других мирах. О самой игре, в целом, можно только сказать - Браво!!! 

Для тех кто не хочет читать всю эту писанину и не играл в игру, скажу лишь одно - сыграйте и пройдите её до конца, это одна из тех игр, что западают в душу, которую вы не забудете.

А теперь немного опишу игру в общих чертах:

Отдельной части заслуживает Элизабет. Самый живой и естественный по характеру персонаж, в некоторых людях меньше жизненности, чем в ней. Проходя игру ты видишь как растёт и меняется персонаж, от юной милашки познающей окружающий мир до всезнающей и холодной женщины, которой предстоит сделать трудное решение. В неё невозможно не влюбиться. Не могу выразить словами всё восприятие этого персонажа, очень трудно было понимать, что игра пройдена и пора с ней прощаться. Немогу не написать про её танцы в начале игры, очень живые, заводные и естественные, возможно звучит очень странно, но самые настоящие и красивые танцы из всех игр, пока. Она так беззаботно танцует и налождается музыкой, что не хочется её прерывать

Выражу своё мнение по другим аспектам игры, начнём с графики: она хороша, особенно всё. что связано с Элизабет, платья, голубые глаза, эмоции... она чудесна. Все остальные персонажи, тоже хорошо проработаны и очень разные. 

Сюжет - выше всяких похвал, когда он начинает слегка наскучивать, сразу существенно меняется локация позволяющяя по другому взглянуть на бои. Появляются новые оружия, способности, тактические ходы и поэтому до конца игры сохраняется некая новизна.  История даётся постепенно и ускоряется под конец. На твоих глазах меняется весь мир, приводя всё к шикарнейшему финалу.

Звук - местами очень резкие, но очень интересные звуковые эффекты. Тут мало, что можно сказать, про сами звуки, разве, что про звонкие и тревожные крики Соловья, в целом они как во многих других играх, но вот музыка это нечто. Очень живописно передаётся атмосфера этого мира, в разных местах исполняется разная музыка оживляющая эту часть города. В церквях поют хором люди, в начале игры, когда все радосные, везде игрют песни начала 20-го века (такие беззаботные приятные), в бедном районе дети поют печальные песни, в каменоломне все хором поют.... мир живёт своей жизнью, законами. 

Отдельно скажу про локализацию, точнее о руссификации. Это - шикарно, лучшая озвучка, голоса очень натуральные и передают характер героев, все эмоции (особенно Элизабет и Буккер) переданы превосходно. Проходил игру дважды, на второй раз вдохновила как раз руссификация. Студия осуществившая перевод сделала невероятное, перевела все надписи и диалоги(даже мелкие и незначительные), и причём не просто через переводчик, а грамотно и эмоционально. 

После прохождения игры захотелось вспышку из "Люди в чёрном", чтобы всё забыть и пройти игру заново. Эта игра шедевр и она подарила больше эмоций и переживаний, чем многие фильмы. Большое спасибо создателям игры и студии осуществившей перевод!
just finished the game and i would say i am impressed ! I liked almost everything ! most of all the story !

After a few years and well over 150 hours played, it might seem redundant to write a review, but what the heck. I love BioShock Infinite, but I'm also frustrated by it. This game could have been genre-defining, it could have been a revolution. Unfortunately all the best intentions and biggest budget in the world couldn't achieve the lofty goals they set. 

The thematic elements are genius, how they turned their limitation of linearity into a beautiful story and theme of its own, but at what cost? As much as I still enjoy re-playing the game, the gorgeous art and top draw acting can't disguise that the underlying systems don't mesh with what they're trying to do- the mass murder just doesn't feel appropriate to this setting (these are regular cops and downtrodden folk coming at you, not jabbering zombies or mutated monstrosities) and Infinite's gunplay is lackluster compared to even other entries in its own series. Which means some parts are a bit of a slog to get through, and you often have to mentally divorce the moment to moment gameplay from the overarching story.

Like the original games, the floating city of Columbia is the real star of BioShock Infinite, and it's a wonderful place to visit in all its multi-dimensional incarnations, looting every container in sight and picking up audio diaries as you go. While there are indeed moments of quiet, like exploring a sunny beach or roaming the amusements arcade, most of the time you're fighting your way through the place. 

That wouldn't be so bad if the fighting wasn't so dull, with encounters being quite frequent and always playing out similarly without much in the way of enemy variety and no ability to plan before battles. I mean, you CAN lay down traps with Vigours, but this uses up too much juice to be very practical for much of the game. All enemies are openly hostile, there's no middle ground like with Big Daddies, stealth is useless and you can't carry around extra weapons or resources like health packs. This leads to frantically scrounging through trash cans and corpses in the heat of battle to find health items a lot of the time. Eventually you acquire enough Vigour powers and gear upgrades that the fighting starts to become interesting, but at that point you're nearing the end of the game. Still, it's all pulled off with a fair bit of pizazz using some seriously cool effects (flaming electrified crows!) and a wonderfully reactive soundtrack that plays little stingers when you get headshots and the like. 

Your main goal of course is to rescue Elizabeth from the city, and she is an eminently likeable and believable character that shows real emotion (in cutscenes). Out of cutscenes, Elizabeth is completely ignored by EVERYTHING, even though she's what they're after (okay, with one exception, when she's abducted OFF SCREEN). She rarely feels like a real person outside of very specific interactions during actual gameplay, reverting to a glass-eyed automaton for a lot of the time with none of the dynamism or responsiveness shown pre-release, falling well short of expectations set in the same category by Naughty Dog or Valve. Her story's great, her design is mostly great, the voice acting's great (if a bit breathy), but she's just not very well realized in the actual GAME part of the game. In combat, the mechanic of her randomly throwing you supplies is also pretty awkward. After 100+ hours I can kinda predict when it's likely to happen, but there's definitely some randomness as to when she'll bother to toss you that vital vial. 

Maybe I love Infinite more for the dream of what it could have been, than the actual thing they delivered, I don't know. I think back to the original vision demo that Irrational produced, which promised untold freedom of combat and reactivity from the environment, plus a potentially much more interesting Elizabeth whose powers had more variety but were also hazardous to her health. The reality falls a bit short. It's still a very fun theme park ride of a game, held together with some top notch storytelling, but the environment is very nailed down and smaller scale than one would expect and you kinda have to grit your teeth through certain sections. 

Although I feel we saw barely half of their original intentions come to fruition, what we got to play through is still awe inspiring, moving and thought provoking. For comparison's sake, if Mass Effect 3 failed due to being rushed out and designed by committe, Infinite is the polar opposite, where years of complete freedom led to a mess of gameplay elements that never quite gel or reach their full potential but still make for a compelling, if flawed, experience. 

They failed trying to do the impossible and I find that admirable. Definitely recommended.
One of my favorite games ever, amazing history and desing, love it :)

A truly masterpiece, the story is GREAT and the visual is stunning!


Great game!

I don't usually write reviews, but after experiencing this game I feel compelled to add my voice to the many that have already extolled Bioshock Infinite.

I finished the main story several months ago and have played plenty of other games since, but my mind keeps rolling back to Bioshock. The beautifully detailed yet horrifying world of Columbia, the mind-bending story, the emotional connection you develop with the NPC Elizabeth... the excellent voice acting and dialogue, the stunning cutscenes and scripted events, the FUN of the skyhook and the vigors... I could go on and on.

During my playthrough I found myself telling my non-gamer girlfriend all about this game, saying that in every sitdown with it I found myself gasping at some new something experienced in-game.

I can't recommend this game enough. It's certainly one of the top FPSs ever made.

[h1]- ¿Le tienes miedo a dios Booker?
- No, pero te tengo miedo a ti.[/h1]

Antes que nada voy a aclarar que mi experiencia con la saga empezo con este titulo, Bioshock Infinite.
Desde el comienzo se nos da el control de Booker DeWitt, un investigador privado del que no sabemos, solo una frase que se nos repite una y otra vez. [b]Traenos a la chica y borraras tu deuda[/b]
Empezamos en una barca en el medio del mar, sin saber como llegamos ahi ni hacia donde vamos, una noche lluviosa donde se divisa un faro que parece ser nuestro destino, al llegar alli los individuos nos abandonaran repitiendo la misma frase, traenos a la chica y borraras tu deuda, y eso es lo que pensamos hacer, verdad?
En la cima del faro encontraremos una especie de transporte que nos llevara donde da comienzo la aventura. Columbia, una ciudad flotante regida por un denominado Profeta.

En lo que al gameplay se refiere, puedo destacar las siguientes cosas. Una amplia variedad de armas y una variante de armas de otra faccion con funciones similares. Tambien dispondremos de vigorizantes, similares a un hechizo que consumen sal como si fuece mana. Estos tiene 2 variables de uso, de forma rapida presionando el boton o de forma sostenida para usarlos a modo de trampa y que se active cuando un enemigo pase cerca de el. Hay varios vigorizantes de diferentes usos y si se combinan entre ellos, es decir lanzarlos en cierto orden, se pueden lograr combinaciones que amplifican sus efectos.
Tambien tendremos 3 tipos de tiendas diferentes, unas para comprar municion, salud y sal, y las otras 2 para mejorar armas y vigorizantes en sus respectivos casos.
Los mapeados son lineales salvo por algunas zonas esconidas o bloqueadas (estas requeriran de contar con ganzuas para poder acceder a ellas) que permiten encontrar voxafonos, telescopios y diarios, estos son los complementos para desentramar toda la historia y a los personajes que se nos presenten y tambien a la ciudad de Columbia.

Visualmente es mucho mas colorido. por lo que vi. que Bioshock 1 y 2. Pasar de estar debajo del agua a estar en una ciudad entre las nubes ayuda mucho en estos casos. Porque permite crear un entorno que se siente mas vivo y colorido que sus predecesores.

Para terminar me gustaria decir que jugue este juego en 2016 por primera vez y me bolo la cabeza porque esperaba un juego de tiros como a los que estaba acostumbrado y sin prestar mucha atencion a la historia y los detalles que me estaban contando, sin comprender lo que realmente estaba pasando. Lo acabo de volver a re jugar en 2020, y me asombra lo bien que envejecio este titulo.

[b][u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Lambo215/recommended/214932?snr=1_5_9__402]ANALISIS BURIAL AT SEA EPISODIO 2[/url][/u][/b]
Лучшая игра в которую я играл!!!!!
Not perfect but certainly worth a playthrough, incredible optimization too.

Na hora de apreciar o cenário, ouvir dialogos e assistir ao game, confesso, ele é satisfatório. Fiquei animado com o inicio, mas bastou a ação chegar que os problemas vieram. Durante meu gameplay, foi dificil jogar mais de uma hora sem me distrair com coisas paralelas. É tedioso. Enjoativo. Insuportável. Em sua maior parte, o game não é divertido. A história não é grande coisa, não mesmo, mas é agradavel ao baixo preço pago por mim. O final até que me proporcionou certo deleite, mas isto fica por Elizabeth, sua doçura e feminilidade.

Prós:

- Belos gráficos, ambientação, trilha sonora e arte.
- História até que cativante. 

Contra:

- História linear.
- Combate repetitivo.
- Pouca inovação.
- Inteligência Artificial deplorável.


Se comparado ao primeiro titulo da franquia em aspectos que não englobam o enredo, Infinite é, definitivamente, inferior.
Infinite está para mais para Call of Duty do que Bioshock.

无论是 1950 年大西洋的中央还是 1912 年缅因州的海岸，无论是 Jack Ryan 还是 Booker DeWitt，无论是 Rapture 还是 Colombia……

一切都太浪漫了。

如果你错过了夏季促销，现在入正也是并不亏的！！
神

No sé que decir, acabo de terminar el juego y me provocó un ACV. Es una obra de arte que no llega a mis niveles de comprensión.

Me voló la peluca.

Infinite/10

When the final credits rolled I sat and stared at my screen contimplating the entirity of my playthrough and what it all meant. I must have sat there for a good twenty minutes. I then tried to go to sleep - but I couldn't. I've never been impacted by a game like that.

Most of those feelings above I would attribute to the story. It's one of the most engrossing and compelling that I have encountered in gaming. 

The gameplay (I played on normal) was challenging and varied enough with the different types of guns and powers to keep me interested for the entire playthrough. 

The graphics are downright breathtaking. From the first scene, to some of the most beautiful moments I've experienced in gaming at the end, this game is worthy of an art museum. 

I give this game a major thumbs up, would recommend it at any price point, and now list it as one of my all-time favorite games.
怎么说呢……我一般是不怎么喜欢写评价的……我好歹也是玩了几百个游戏了……这游戏的氛围是我觉得最诡异的……有这么点宗教的感觉……诡异……对……只有这个词能形容我的感受……不喜欢，卸载了……我玩到大概第五章吧，就觉得好无趣，没什么意思的一个游戏……

Sí lo recomiendo, pero no lo considero una obra maestra. Del 1 al 10 le daria un 7.5... no le pongo un 8 porque Bioshock es un buen juego, pero tiene un estilo que es siempre lo mismo: Una historia artificialmente compleja y melancolica que siempre acaba mal. Y eso se vuelve monotono y predecible. Es como si pasaras 3 veces el mismo juego, salvo que aquí la ciudad está en el cielo y no bajo el agua como los dos anteriores. Considero que es el mejor de la trilogia, pero no es ni de lejos mi trilogia/saga favorita.

重要的事说三遍！

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
上世代叙事互动艺术的巅峰之作
只看第一章就可以看出环境衬托，暗喻、象征和镜头设计等等的叙事手法，老掉牙的墙壁涂鸦和音乐什么的就不说了
还有各种伪自由的互动
全篇还带着各种逼格的政治哲学意味，最后一章更是直接点题“无限”，并且和首章完美对应
总的来说，fps叙事当之无愧的巅峰

作为一个暴雪脑残粉，我觉得暴雪没有任何一个作品能比的上此作，游戏人生20年，甚至找不到任何一款游戏比得上此作。
这不是游戏，是艺术。

Я прошёл эту игру за двое суток непрерывного вылазинья из-за компа... И знаете морально она очень тяжело дается, я в конце, это просто бомба... Разрабы игры не просто сделали её а*еренно красивой при слабых системных требованиях, они просто так постарались над сюжетом, что все вокруг кажется таких тупым в нашем мире... Элизабет... Герои игры - это вообще ... игра просто на высоте. Я желею, что купил и прошёл её, так как очень трудно проходить морально... Я сто раз еще повторю... Сюжет, графика... Если не хотите понимать внутренний мир игры, а берете ради ачивок, то просто иди те НА...
